page.title: 13Housing on Darlington Road.
page.content: There has been a great deal of housing development in the easten end of Richmond.In 1960 Shepherds of York began building the first phase of an estate of brick houses on the north side of Darlington Road.The second phase was built east of Cross Lanes and eventually a third phase was completed in the Aske Avenue area. George Shaw began building the Whitefield estate on the south side of Darlington Road east of Cross Lanes.These are of brick and stone construction. Presently Randall Orchard is making use of the last available land on Darlington Road to build the Scots Dikes estate. These houses are timber framed and clad in stone. There is now no further building land available inside the borough boundary in eastern Richmond.
